issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
When RawLocalFileSyste.append() is called it returns an FSDataOutputStream whose .getPos() returns 0.
getPos() should return position in the file where appends will start writing.
fields.summary: RawLocalFileSystem.append() should give FSDataOutputStream with accurate .getPos()

comments.body: patch forthcoming

Yes, the position will come as zero, because it directly opens the FileOutPutstream in append mode. This will ensures that the data to go at the end of the file.
fixing this would be simple, we can set the position on fileChannel position to the length of the file. But i am not sure this is really a bug or not, because the author intention is to leave as it is equal behavior with FileOutPutStream when opening in append mode....?

This message was automatically generated.

Thanks for updating the patch [~kanaka]. 
Source changes looks good.

Have some nits in test.
1. {{fs}} is not closed after test.
2. {{in}} also not closed.
3. Use default value 'build/test/data' for {{System.getProperty("test.build.data", ".")}}
I think, test can be added in existing {{TestLocalFileSystem}} class itself instead of creating new file.

Thanks for the review [~vinayrpet]. I have moved the test code to {{TestLocalFileSystem}} and handled the comments except the first one to close the fs. 

We can close {{FileSystem}} by making  {{fileSys}} static in a method with annotation {{@AfterClass}} but I felt it may be un related change for this JIRA context as it's an old file and some other test classes for example {{TestCryptoStreamsForLocalFS}} are also not closing localFS. 
So, we can file a separate JIRA to handle this in all such files. What is your opinion?

\\

bq. We can close FileSystem by making fileSys static in a method with annotation @AfterClass but I felt it may be un related change for this JIRA context as it's an old file and some other test classes for example TestCryptoStreamsForLocalFS are also not closing localFS. 
So, we can file a separate JIRA to handle this in all such files. What is your opinion?
Since the whole test is moved to {{TestLocalFileSystem}}, this change is not needed for local fs.
Anyway, my main concern was the closing of open streams, thats handled in latest patch. So I am fine with that.

Latest patch looks good to me. +1.
Will commit soon

Committed to trunk and branch-2.
Thanks for the contribution [~ktomasette] and [~kanaka].
